post_text: A new month means a new Regal Eagle award recipient. This award was started to highlight residents and graduates from my favorite school, in my favorite village. The award this month goes to Patrick Budds. Patrick graduated from Odin in 1992. He has chosen a career in law enforcement and has been making a difference ever since. Officer Budds was assigned to a DEA task force for 11 years and was recently presented with an award from the US Department of Justice for the work he did there. He is currently an officer in O’fallon Missouri where he has been proudly representing law enforcement while setting an exemplary standard of being a good person we should all strive to achieve. Thank you Officer Budds, we are proud of you in the village and proud to call you not just an Eagle- but a Regal Eagle.

To Seniors:

Just drove through the village. Our school, the Fire Department, and the park lights are all lit up tonight to honor our Seniors at Odin High School. This is not the way any of us anticipated this year to end. It’s extremely heartbreaking and unfortunate!

However, many started school here in PreK, others became part of our school community, our family, later. Regardless, you Seniors have so many memories of school. You’re missing 2 two months of a grand total of 12 or more years. And yes, these were important months. Trips, awards, dinners, and yes, graduation were all scheduled in May.

Hang on to the memories that you have made at OHS. Think about the meaningful relationships that you’ve made with your classmates and staff. No matter where your path takes you in your life, always know that you’re an EAGLE!

Lastly, this school and this community is here for you and love you very much!

Mr. Alli
Your Principal

March 20, 2020
Dear Parents/Guardians,

Our Accelerated Reader program through Renaissance Learning is challenging students to engage in reading and to continue to build their reading skills. During the mandated school closure, students may take Accelerated Reader tests at home.

Thank you!
